00008 namespace gigide {

00010 template <class Item>
00011 class PermutationGenerator : public Countable
00012 {
00013     private:
00014         bool finished_;
00015         int* index_used_;
00016         int* indices_;
00017         std::vector<Item> items_;
00018         int running_index_;
00019         int length_;
00020         int n_;
00021         void nextindex(int idx);
00022 
00023     public:
00024         PermutationGenerator(std::vector<Item>& items, int n);
00025         ~PermutationGenerator();
00026         bool nextPermutation();
00027         void generatePermutations(
00028             std::vector< std::vector<Item> >& all_perms

00031 
00032 template <class Item>
00033 PermutationGenerator<Item>::PermutationGenerator(std::vector<Item>& items, int n)
00034 {
00035     //first thing's first! The permutation generator expects sorted items
00036     sort(items.begin(), items.end());
00037 
00038     running_index_ = n - 1;
00039     length_ = items.size();
00040 
00041     this->items_ = items;
00042 
00043     index_used_ = new int[length_];
00044     indices_ = new int[n];
00045     //set the initial indices - these will get reset later
00046     for (int i=0; i < n; i++)
00047     {
00048         indices_[i] = 0;
00049     }
00050     //zero out the rest of the index used array
00051     for (int i=0; i < length_; i++)
00052         index_used_[i] = 0;
00053 
00054     //we can't just start the indices at 0,1,2, etc
00055     //in case of repeats, we may have to shift the indices along
00056     for (int idx = 0; idx <= running_index_; idx++)
00057     {
00058         while ( (indices_[idx] + 1 < length_) && 
00059                 (!index_used_[indices_[idx] + 1]) &&
00060                 (items_[indices_[idx]] == items_[indices_[idx] + 1]) ||
00061                 (index_used_[indices_[idx]]) )
00062         {
00063             indices_[idx]++;
00064         }
00065         //and now that we have found the final value, claim it!
00066         index_used_[indices_[idx]] = 1;
00067     }
00068     finished_ = false;
00069 
00070     n_ = n;
00071 }
00072 
00073 template <class Item>
00074 PermutationGenerator<Item>::~PermutationGenerator()
00075 {
00076     delete[] index_used_;
00077     delete[] indices_;
00078 }
00079 
00080 template <class Item>
00081 bool
00082 PermutationGenerator<Item>::nextPermutation()
00083 {
00084     nextindex(running_index_);
00085     return !finished_;
00086 }
00087 
00088 template <class Item>
00089 void
00090 PermutationGenerator<Item>::nextindex(int idx)
00091 {
00092     if (idx < 0) 
00093     {
00094         finished_ = true; 
00095         return;
00096     }
00097     
00098 
00099     int startindex = indices_[idx];
00100     bool zero_return = false;
00101     while( 
00102            index_used_[indices_[idx]] || //if we can shift to other values
00103            ((indices_[idx] + 1 < length_) && (items_[indices_[idx]] == items_[indices_[idx]+1]) && (!index_used_[indices_[idx] + 1]))
00104          )
00105     {
00106         indices_[idx]++;
00107         //if we have reached the end of the indices, go back to the beginning
00108         if (indices_[idx] == length_)
00109         {
00110             indices_[idx] = 0;
00111             index_used_[startindex] = 0;
00112             zero_return = true;
00113             nextindex(idx - 1);
00114         }
00115     }
00116     //lay claim to new value
00117     index_used_[indices_[idx]] = 1;
00118     //and release claim on old value, assuming we haven't loop back on ourselves
00119     //if we have looped back, then we have already release the old index
00120     if (!zero_return) index_used_[startindex] = 0;
00121     //
00122     return;
00123 }
00124 
00125 template <class Item>
00126 void
00127 PermutationGenerator<Item>::generatePermutations(
00128     std::vector< std::vector<Item> >& all_perms
00129 )
00130 {
00131     //we always add a first permutation
00132     std::vector<Item> first_perm;
00133     for (int i=0; i < n_; i++)
00134         first_perm.push_back(items_[indices_[i]]);
00135     all_perms.push_back(first_perm);
00136 
00137     //now get the rest of the permutations
00138     while (nextPermutation())
00139     {
00140         std::vector<Item> next_perm;
00141         for (int i=0; i < n_; i++)
00142             next_perm.push_back(items_[indices_[i]]);
00143         all_perms.push_back(next_perm);
00144     }
00145 }

00147 
00148 }
